scenario:
Wall Street's fourth-quarter earnings season begins next week with notable names such as JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, BlackRock, Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, UnitedHealth, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reporting their financial results. The earnings season gathers momentum in the final week of January when mega-cap tech companies, including Microsoft, Alphabet, Tesla, Meta Platforms, Amazon, and Apple, release their quarterly updates.

Analysts expect annualized profit growth of +11.9% and an increase of +4.6% in revenue growth. The sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%, while the sector is forecast to come in second, with +20.7% year-over-year EPS growth.

The sector is expected to report the third-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +14%. In contrast, earnings from the sector are expected to tumble -24.6% compared to last year, the worst drop of any sector by far.

The S&P 500 is expected to report annualized sales growth of +4.6%, compared to expectations for revenue growth of +5.2% at the end of September. Eight sectors are projected to report year-over-year growth in revenues, led by the Information Technology and Utilities sectors, at +11.1% and +8.0%, respectively.

Thirty-eight stocks are forecast to deliver growth of more than 25% in both earnings per share and revenue, including Astera Labs, Nvidia, Coinbase, Super Micro Computer, Reddit, Robinhood, Seagate, Western Digital, AppLovin, Trade Desk, DraftKings, CrowdStrike, Cloudflare, Snowflake, and Palantir.
